name: Final Fantasy VIIR: Beneath a Stolen Sky
general_description:
“Beneath a Stolen Sky” is a tribute to Midgar Area tracks from Final Fantasy VII, keeping to the spirit of the Remake. The title is of course inspired by Shinra building the “Floating Pizza” higher society city above the homes of the lower society people’s houses, stealing the sky from them.

Originally composed by series veteran Nobuo Uematsu, this album features 23 re-arrangements/remixes from tracks that you can hear in the Midgar area in the original FFVII game + the Remake main theme “Hollow”. This album involved more than 30 musicians and is the 1st of a compilation of albums that will more or less follow the the releases of the next parts of the Remake, also including the original tracks.
project_involvement:
I contributed a cover to “Shinra Company”, a dynamic theme that shows both the dark nature and implicit power that the Shinra Company has over their citizens in the game.

Considering that I composed this remix ahead of the Remake’s release and hearing that development would include new clips featuring Shinra propaganda, I decided to run with that idea a bit. The result is an epic rendition featuring 6 voice talents, Cello work by Chromatic Apparatus, and wonderful guitar work by guest Yuki K.
